title.narrative: 06.3 MICRONUTRIENT CONTROL PROGRAMME

description.narrative: 2014-16 Output 6.3: 'By 2016, relevant health facilities (Provincial and County Hospitals, Health Clinics and Baby Homes) and institutions (salt factories) have the capacity to operationalize the approved micronutrient guidelines. 2011-13 Old Intermediate Results (IR) 9.3 By 2015, relevant health facilities (Provincial and County Hospitals, Health Clinics and Baby Homes) and institutions (salt factories) have the capacity to operationalize the approved micronutrient guidelines., which contributes to Micronutrients, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 2013 - 2016 Outcome 06: By 2016, the Government implements a comprehensive sustainable nutrition programme including adequate Infant and Young Child Feeding (IYCF), Micronutrients and Management of Acute Malnutrition programmes2011 - 2013 Programme Component Results (PCR) 9: By 2015, child and maternal nutrition improved at local and national levels. (By 2015, the Government implement a comprehensive sustainable nutrition programme including adequate Infant and Young Child Feeding, Micronutrients and Management of Acute Malnutrition programs)

sector.narrative: Breastfeeding protection, promotion and support (including work on Code)
Salt iodization and other large-scale food fortification
Vitamin A supplementation in early childhood (children under 5)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 2014-16 Output 6.3: 'By 2016, relevant health facilities (Provincial and County Hospitals, Health Clinics and Baby Homes) andinstitutions (salt factories) have the capacity to operationalize the approved micronutrient guidelines. 2011-13 Old IR 9.3 By2015, relevant health facilities (Provincial and County Hospitals, Health Clinics and Baby Homes) and institutions (salt factories)have the capacity to operationalize the approved micronutrient guidelines.

description.narrative: Twice-yearly CHD activities including vitamin A supplementation, deworming, provision of Sprinkles to children aged 6 to 23 months, and MUAC screening and referral to CMAM service delivery sites achieved 99 per cent coverage. | Status:Met | As-of Date:09/01/2017

title.narrative: 6.3.c. No stock-out of micronutrient supplies in the central and provincial medical warehouse

actual.value: 2017:Zero stock-out reported in 2016. The programme facilitated quarterly distribution of all nutrition and micronutrient supplies to the operational service delivery sites in the hospitals and baby-homes. hospitals.

title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) Supply to provide two annual doses of Vitamin A supplements to all children aged 6-59 months available
